verses.roman:
mahā-bhāgavata yadunātha kavicandra
yāṅhāra hṛdaye nṛtya kare nityānanda

synonyms: mahā-bhāgavata—a great devotee; yadunātha kavicandra—of the name Yadunātha Kavicandra; yāṅhāra—whose; hṛdaye—in the heart; nṛtya—dancing; kare—does; nityānanda—Lord Nityānanda Prabhu.
translation: Yadunātha Kavicandra was a great devotee. Lord Nityānanda Prabhu always danced in his heart.

purport.content: In the Caitanya-bhāgavata, Madhya-līlā, Chapter One, it is said that a gentleman known as Ratnagarbha Ācārya was a friend of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's father. They were residents of the same village. He had three sons-Kṛṣṇānanda, Jīva and Yadunātha Kavicandra.
